info.title: Dietary Supplement API
info.description: A product taken by mouth that contains a dietary ingredient intended to supplement the diet. Dietary ingredients may include vitamins, minerals, herbs or other botanicals, amino acids, and substances such as enzymes, organ tissues, glandulars and metabolites.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Keyword search for item

parameters.name: activeingredient
parameters.description: An active ingredient, typically chemical compounds and/or biologic substances.

parameters.name: additionaltype
parameters.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

parameters.name: adverseoutcome
parameters.description: A possible complication and/or side effect of this therapy. If it is known that an adverse outcome is serious (resulting in death, disability, or permanent damage; requiring hospitalization; or is otherwise life-threatening or requires immediate medical attention), tag it as a seriouseAdverseOutcome instead.

parameters.name: alternatename
parameters.description: An alias for the item.

parameters.name: background
parameters.description: Descriptive information establishing a historical perspective on the supplement. May include the rationale for the name, the population where the supplement first came to prominence, etc.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: A medical code for the entity, taken from a controlled vocabulary or ontology such as ICD-9, DiseasesDB, MeSH, SNOMED-CT, RxNorm, etc.

parameters.name: contraindication
parameters.description: A contraindication for this therapy.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A short description of the item.

parameters.name: dosageform
parameters.description: A dosage form in which this drug/supplement is available, e.g. 'tablet', 'suspension', 'injection'.

parameters.name: duplicatetherapy
parameters.description: A therapy that duplicates or overlaps this one.

parameters.name: guideline
parameters.description: A medical guideline related to this entity.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

parameters.name: indication
parameters.description: A factor that indicates use of this therapy for treatment and/or prevention of a condition, symptom, etc. For therapies such as drugs, indications can include both officially-approved indications as well as off-label uses. These can be distinguished by using the ApprovedIndication subtype of MedicalIndication.

parameters.name: isproprietary
parameters.description: True if this item's name is a proprietary/brand name (vs. generic name).

parameters.name: legalstatus
parameters.description: The drug or supplement's legal status, including any controlled substance schedules that apply.

parameters.name: mainentityofpage
parameters.description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described.            See background notes for details.       Inverse property: mainEntity.

parameters.name: manufacturer
parameters.description: The manufacturer of the product.

parameters.name: maximumintake
parameters.description: Recommended intake of this supplement for a given population as defined by a specific recommending authority.

parameters.name: mechanismofaction
parameters.description: The specific biochemical interaction through which this drug or supplement produces its pharmacological effect.

parameters.name: medicinesystem
parameters.description: The system of medicine that includes this MedicalEntity, for example 'evidence-based', 'homeopathic', 'chiropractic', etc.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the item.

parameters.name: nonproprietaryname
parameters.description: The generic name of this drug or supplement.

parameters.name: potentialaction
parameters.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

parameters.name: recognizingauthority
parameters.description: If applicable, the organization that officially recognizes this entity as part of its endorsed system of medicine.

parameters.name: recommendedintake
parameters.description: Recommended intake of this supplement for a given population as defined by a specific recommending authority.

parameters.name: relevantspecialty
parameters.description: If applicable, a medical specialty in which this entity is relevant.

parameters.name: safetyconsideration
parameters.description: Any potential safety concern associated with the supplement. May include interactions with other drugs and foods, pregnancy, breastfeeding, known adverse reactions, and documented efficacy of the supplement.

parameters.name: sameas
parameters.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.

parameters.name: seriousadverseoutcome
parameters.description: A possible serious complication and/or serious side effect of this therapy. Serious adverse outcomes include those that are life-threatening; result in death, disability, or permanent damage; require hospitalization or prolong existing hospitalization; cause congenital anomalies or birth defects; or jeopardize the patient and may require medical or surgical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes in this definition.

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: A medical study or trial related to this entity.

parameters.name: targetpopulation
parameters.description: Characteristics of the population for which this is intended, or which typically uses it, e.g. 'adults'.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the item.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id for item

parameters.name: id
